page.title: 05Religion in the parishes
page.content: Religion in the area is quite strong although there aren't large congregrations at the three parish churches,but there are strong links between the village people and the church.This is shown in the way the churches are maintained in good condition.Thoroton church is St.Helens and is partly Norman and late 14th century as is the circular stone dove cote.Shelton church is St.Marys and was built in the late 12th century and early 13th century and is on a ridge overlooking the R.Smite.Flawborough church,St.Peters isn't so old being re-built in 1840 but there is a lovely view from its churchyard which overlooks both the villages.Alverton has no church but is peculiar in that one side of its only habited road is allied to Kilvington and Staunton parish.The main regular services are
